summary: Tested Master Work Order creation flow - Bug NOT REPRODUCIBLE. All 9 requested features are working correctly. Job role selection in Step 2 works as expected: dropdown opens, shows available roles, clicking adds to selected list, targets can be entered, and 'Next: SDC Districts' button enables when targets are fully allocated. Successfully created a new work order (WO/TEST/FINAL3) through the complete 3-step flow.
passed_tests: Master Data page loads correctly with all tabs (Work Orders, Job Roles, Resources)
Click 'New Work Order' button opens dialog
Step 1: Work Order Number input works
Step 1: Total Training Target input works
Step 1: Number of Job Roles dropdown works
Step 1: 'Next: Select Job Roles' button enables when form is valid
Step 2: Job Role dropdown shows available job roles (CSC/Q0801, ELE/Q4601)
Step 2: Clicking a job role ADDS it to selected list
Step 2: Target input for each selected job role works
Step 2: Target allocation progress bar updates correctly
Step 2: 'Target fully allocated' message shows when targets sum to total
Step 2: 'Next: SDC Districts' button enables when all job roles selected and targets allocated
Step 3: District name input works
Step 3: SDC count dropdown works
Step 3: Add district (+) button adds district to list
Step 3: District badge shows with correct format (e.g., 'Udaipur (1 SDC)')
Step 3: Total SDCs counter updates correctly
Step 3: 'Create Work Order' button enables when at least one district added
Final submit creates Master Work Order successfully
Success toast 'Master Work Order created successfully' appears
New work order appears in list with 'active' status
seed_data_creation: Created test work order WO/TEST/FINAL3 with 100 students, 2 job roles (CSC/Q0801: 50, ELE/Q4601: 50), 1 SDC district (Udaipur)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Bug reported by user (cannot move ahead of job role selection) was NOT REPRODUCIBLE. The Master Work Order creation flow works correctly through all 3 steps. Job role selection dropdown opens, shows available roles, clicking adds to selected list, targets can be entered, and navigation to Step 3 works when targets are fully allocated. The + button for adding districts requires clicking the actual button element (last button in the flex container), not the Select dropdown.

bug_investigation.reported_issue: User reports they CANNOT move ahead of job role selection while entering a new Master Work Order
bug_investigation.details: Tested the complete Master Work Order creation flow multiple times. Job role selection in Step 2 works correctly: dropdown opens and shows 2 available job roles (CSC/Q0801, ELE/Q4601), clicking a job role adds it to the selected list with default target, user can modify targets, and when targets are fully allocated (sum equals total training target), the 'Next: SDC Districts' button enables. Successfully created a new work order through the complete flow.
bug_investigation.possible_user_error: User may have been confused by the target allocation requirement - the 'Next: SDC Districts' button only enables when: 1) All required job roles are selected (based on 'Number of Job Roles' setting), AND 2) The sum of all job role targets equals the 'Total Training Target'. If targets don't sum correctly, the button remains disabled.

step1_basic_info.details: Work Order Number, Total Training Target, Number of Job Roles, Awarding Body, Scheme Name all work correctly

step2_job_role_selection.details: Dropdown opens, shows available roles, clicking adds to list, targets can be entered, progress bar updates, 'Next' button enables when fully allocated

step3_sdc_districts.details: District input works, SDC count dropdown works, + button adds district, badge shows correctly, 'Create Work Order' enables when district added

final_submission.details: Work order created successfully, success toast shown, new work order appears in list
